definition: focus/with complete devotion/stubbornly
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
to concentrate on

sentences.english: Little Cat listened to Old Cat's words and begin to fish intently.
sentences.chinese: 小貓聽了老貓的話，就一心一意地釣魚。

sentences.english: He was single -mindedly devoted to the hastening of freedom for the oppressed.
sentences.chinese: 他一心一意致力於早日讓被壓迫者獲得自由。

sentences.english: He followed the speaker's words with the greatest attention.
sentences.chinese: 他專心一意地傾聽演講者的話。

sentences.english: Olaf Martens pursues his own ideas.
sentences.chinese: 馬斯滕對自己的觀念一意孤行。

sentences.english: Only to concentrate more on things to do now is more perfect.
sentences.chinese: 只有更專注專心一意把現在的事情做到更完美。

sentences.english: As a result, Seigo began to observe his wife wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 於是，省吾開始一心一意地觀察起妻子的活動。

sentences.english: They never pursue self-interests but work wholeheartedly for the revolution.
sentences.chinese: 他們從不謀求私利，而是一心一意爲革命工作。

sentences.english: It's time to let your Sagittarius charm take over not your pushiness .
sentences.chinese: 是時候發揮妳射手座魅力了，不要一意孤行啊。

sentences.english: "Well, " said Charlotte, "I wish Jane success with all my heart;
sentences.chinese: “唔，”夏綠蒂說，“我一心一意祝吉英成功。

sentences.english: Mugabe knows he cannot go it alone.
sentences.chinese: 穆加貝明白他不能一意孤行。

sentences.english: There was Dave, bending over the roses, carefully heaping mulch around every plant.
sentences.chinese: 那是大衛，彎下玫瑰，一心一意的爲每一株植物護根。

sentences.english: That’s why he practices 4 hours a day. He’s dedicated.
sentences.chinese: 所以他每天需要練4個小時，一心一意的。

sentences.english: She is always going her own way.
sentences.chinese: 對極了，她總是一意孤行。

sentences.english: From now, I will be a student who is preparing for national college entrance examination.
sentences.chinese: 從今起，我將戒除所有惡習，一心一意，考大學。

sentences.english: If the need arises, we may even break down in tears , until our parents cannot bear to be willful anymore.
sentences.chinese: 必要時還可以聲淚俱下，讓父母不忍心一意孤行下去。

sentences.english: Xi said ice with his single-minded love with Haitian, Haitian laid down their swords.
sentences.chinese: 喜冰說着自己一心一意的愛着海天，海天放下了劍。

definition: disloyalty/half-heartedness/duplicity
concentrating one's thoughts and efforts/single-minded/bent on/intently
to be determined
deliberately/on purpose
to stick up for a wrongdoer
variant of 二心[er4 xin1]
to hold on firmly/to cling (to a belief)/stubbornly
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
change of string, move out of rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction/to dance to a different tune
already
to persist/to continue upholding/to persevere/to stick to sth/stubborn
therefore/so/consequently
paying special care/with particular attention

to block/to prevent by force
